blog.name: princessaryathevaliant
blog.title: Princess Arya the Valiant
blog.description: A devoted fan defending her precious cinnamon roll, its all you need to know!...and i love cheesecake...bye. Currently on hiatus.

summary: I love Ned and Arya’s relationship so much. Its such a source of unconditional love and acceptance for Arya, and you can see in...
body: I love Ned and Arya’s relationship so much. Its such a source of unconditional love and acceptance for Arya, and you can see in her chapters how much that means to her. And i also like how Ned, despite being sort of a traditional guy, goes to great lenghts to support her, even if it sometimes crosses his own set boundaries. In a world where daughters are only seen assets for political advantage and father-daughter relationship stay within the range of distant to forced hero worship, it means a lot to see such a sweet and loving relationship born out of sincere care and acceptance.

In a world where daughters are only seen assets for political advantage and father-daughter relationship stay within the range of distant to forced hero worship, it means a lot to see such a sweet and loving relationship born out of sincere care and acceptance.

summary: I’m going to be sad if arya and Sansa don’t make it to the end. We stan a murder sister duo
question: I’m going to be sad if arya and Sansa don’t make it to the end. We stan a murder sister duo
answer:
Hey anon,

Oh, I’d be devastated if either died. We’ve followed these young ladies since they were little girls throughout all their trails and tribulations. From their lows to their very, very lows with like three highs in between. After everything that’s happened they deserve to make it to the very end and find some semblance of contentment. Really, all our protagonist do.

I do think that both are relatively safe to reach the end of the series. I don’t see any real benefit to having either of them die. How happy or content either of them will be at the end of the series is a different question. One would hope they’ll be at least okay.

TTFN

summary: I sort of wish we’d gotten more of Arya and Lady Crane. I could have done a season with her rather then one of her faceless men...
body: I sort of wish we’d gotten more of Arya and Lady Crane. I could have done a season with her rather then one of her faceless men seasons, or honestly her season with the hound. I just think it would have been really cool to see her with the acting troupe, playing Sansa, and getting some chance to be young again complete with a bad ass mother figure.

tags: these swans are not thirty yards from the shore
summary: Huevember - Day 26.  “Thirty yards from shore, three black swans were gliding over the water, so serene … no one had told them...
caption:
Huevember - Day 26.

“Thirty yards from shore, three black swans were gliding over the water, so serene … no one had told them that war had come, and they cared nothing for burning towns and butchered men. She stared at them with yearning. Part of her wanted to be a swan. The other part wanted to eat one.”

( A Clash of Kings - Arya V )

( A Clash of Kings - Arya V )

summary: Prediction for next season: Faceless men, Dany, Arya
title: Prediction for next season: Faceless men, Dany, Arya
body:
After reading Fire and Blood (I have completed my first reading), I am now increasingly inclined to believe that a Faceless Men hit will be taken out on Dany in the last season. Here is why:

1) We learn that the Faceless Men, as well as the Iron Bank are not completely aloof institutions that have nothing to do with Braavosi state policy, but are actually very closely connected to the Braavosi state and can be seen as acting as instruments of the state (it makes sense though, I mean why else would Braavos allow two such powerful and dangerous institutions to exist on their soil?). When Septon Barth (on behalf of Jaehaerys) makes the threat of a dragon attack on Braavos, the Sealord’s response is to push him to a stalemate by reminding him that Braavos has the Faceless Men (and insinuating that he will have them kill off the Targaryen family). Dragons vs. Faceless Men is basically a seen to be a mutually assured destruction situation. Also the Sealord is able to get the Iron Bank to forgive a substantial amount of Westerosi debt.

2) We learn once more that the suspected Dornish message that forced Aegon the Conqueror to stop his attack on Dorne (despite the fact that Dorne no longer had the strength to fight the Targaryens) was a threat that the Dornish will engage the Faceless Men of Braavos to kill Aegon’s heirs. So twice we have seen that the Faceless Men can be used as a threat to balance the otherwise impossible to beat power of dragons. Also, they may be responsible for destroying Valyria in the first place.

3) We learn again and again of the Braavosi aversion to dragons.

4) The show is showing us that the Iron Bank is on Cersei’s side. On the face of it this seems like a bizarre choice for the Bank to make. Dany may have disturbed the profits they made from the slave trade in Essos, but that is in the past. She is in Westeros now. She has an enormous military advantage. Why is the Bank, which is a financial superpower, and not known for making bad bets, financing her (i.e. Cersei)? The wiser course for the bank seems to be to either support Dany, or to sit this out and see who emerges victorious. Cersei does not have a strong hand vs. dragons. Why are they helping her hire the Golden Company etc.? It makes little sense… Unless they plan to neutralize Dany too. But how else are they to do that except by using the Faceless Men (in the books it also seems like a Faceless man is at the Citadel taking a book that may help him kill dragons)?

5) The biggest weakness in Dany’s entire organizational structure, the one that Tyrion has pointed out, the one that Jaime tried to take advantage of in 7x04 when he tried to kill her, is that the whole thing revolves around her person. Take Dany out of the game and everything collapses completely. The whole threat just vanishes. Makes sense for the Bank to realize this too.

6) I feel that Arya’s whole Faceless men arc will have some deeper endgame consequences too. So far all it’s done (other than the Frey revenge) is just turn her into a great fighter. This is something that she could have become even by hanging out with the Hound or Brienne. The whole thing with the Faceless Men seems to be something that will have deeper consequences than just making Arya into a warrior. She could have become a warrior in a more conventional way. All the weird magical training seems superfluous.

The above reasons make me think that Cersei (with the help of the Bank) will send Faceless Men after Dany. Braavos may lowkey support this. If so, Arya is the only person who has the knowledge and training to be able to thwart such a scheme. This may be a significant subplot next season. What do you think?

blog.name: turtle-paced
blog.title: turtle-paced
blog.description: Writing at the speed of the race course paradox.

summary: Hi turtle - thank you for this lovely blog. I'd like to ask - among Rickon, Bran, Arya, Sansa and Jon, which of the Stark family...
question: Hi turtle - thank you for this lovely blog. I'd like to ask - among Rickon, Bran, Arya, Sansa and Jon, which of the Stark family do you think will be the first pair to reunite? Do you think they'll have some proper time together, where they can talk about their childhood, what they experienced since they split and their plans for their future/the North? Or do you think they will reunite during a time of chaos, so it's more 'so great you're alive, gtg the zombies are coming?'
answer:
Thanks very much!

I tend to think Jon and Sansa will be first to reunite, given that they’re physically the closest to Winterfell. Don’t know which of Arya or Bran makes it back first, and I don’t know how Rickon figures into this (though I am afraid he won’t survive). And yeah, I think they’ll have time to speak to each other - if nothing else, I think Jon, Sansa, Arya and Bran manage to speak to and grieve with each other as they inter Ned’s bones in Winterfell’s crypts.

Thanks very much!

I tend to think Jon and Sansa will be first to reunite, given that they’re physically the closest to Winterfell. Don’t know which of Arya or Bran makes it back first, and I don’t know how Rickon figures into this (though I am afraid he won’t survive). And yeah, I think they’ll have time to speak to each other - if nothing else, I think Jon, Sansa, Arya and Bran manage to speak to and grieve with each other as they inter Ned’s bones in Winterfell’s crypts.

trail.content_raw:
Thanks very much!

I tend to think Jon and Sansa will be first to reunite, given that they’re physically the closest to Winterfell. Don’t know which of Arya or Bran makes it back first, and I don’t know how Rickon figures into this (though I am afraid he won’t survive). And yeah, I think they’ll have time to speak to each other - if nothing else, I think Jon, Sansa, Arya and Bran manage to speak to and grieve with each other as they inter Ned’s bones in Winterfell’s crypts.

Thanks very much!

I tend to think Jon and Sansa will be first to reunite, given that they’re physically the closest to Winterfell. Don’t know which of Arya or Bran makes it back first, and I don’t know how Rickon figures into this (though I am afraid he won’t survive). And yeah, I think they’ll have time to speak to each other - if nothing else, I think Jon, Sansa, Arya and Bran manage to speak to and grieve with each other as they inter Ned’s bones in Winterfell’s crypts.

title: dear future husband
body:
Hot Pie : *tries to steal needle*
Arya : *beats him up*
Yoren : Arya, what you did was impulsive, capricious and melodramatic.
Jaqen : But it was also cool.
Arya : Thanks, hot stranger. I knew you'd understand.
Yoren : Didn't I tell you to stay away from him ?
Arya : You don't get it Yoren ! He's cute.
Jaqen : *grins* A man is.
Yoren : I promised your father...
Arya : I heard the girls giggling with admiration !
Jaqen : I heard you were giggling too.
Arya : *bits her lip and giggles* 
Yoren : Arya, would you please listen to me ? I promised...
Jaqen : A girl could make a friend.
Arya : I want to ! We can kill people together. I've made a list.
Jaqen : A girl has many gifts.

tags: so that’s a whole bunch of points but oh well
I just want tumblr to appreciate her properly
instead of always comparing her to others
summary: I need some Arya positivity so what do you love most about her??
question: I need some Arya positivity so what do you love most about her??
answer:
asdfghjkl just one thing?

my favourite aspect of her character has to be how she never forgets who she is

that despite all the trauma and abuse and tragedy, she holds her family and her identity so close to her heart and seeing the conflict of her trying to become no one is so heartbreaking, but I love her all the more for it.

but also how she rises to the occasion. that even as a child, she fought for justice and was never willing to sell herself out, no matter the threat.

and also!! she makes friends with everyone!! she’s highborn but she makes friends with butcher boys and courtesans and bastards and doesn’t care about where you’re from or how low society thinks you are because she’s so pure and good and so so caring about others and ugh I love her so much

omg and her relationship with jon like this girl is so full of love I can’t how does anyone read her chapters and not fall in love with her, this is the true mystery
